definition: only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: I only honoured my promise to your father.
sentences.chinese: 我只不过完成了我对你父亲的承诺。

sentences.english: The little chicks had no more than whetted his appetite.
sentences.chinese: 那几只小鸡只不过引起了他的食欲而已。

sentences.english: The newly discovered notes are nothing more than Jack's personal journal.
sentences.chinese: 新发现的笔记只不过是杰克的个人日记。

sentences.english: Earth is just a dead thing you can claim.
sentences.chinese: 大地只不过是你能占有的死物。

sentences.english: Rose is simply the new kid on the block, they argue.
sentences.chinese: 罗斯只不过是一个乳臭未干的小子，他们说。

sentences.english: New Presbyter is but old Priest with large.
sentences.chinese: 新长老只不过是更广泛意义上的旧牧师。

sentences.english: Spring festival is over, nothing special happened. I am just sleeping, eating then eating, sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 春节假期过去了，没什么特别，只不过是吃吃睡睡。

sentences.english: I simply don’t want to go without a vehicle.
It took only half an hour by taxi from Congjiang county to Basha.
sentences.chinese: 从江县城打车到岜沙，只不过半个小时车程。

sentences.english: This grating was nothing else than a piece of the brass screens with which aviaries are covered in menageries .
sentences.chinese: 这个纱罩只不过是块动物园里供蒙鸟笼用的铜纱。

sentences.english: This is just one of the many diverse ways that fluidised beds have been used.
sentences.chinese: 这只不过是流化床多种多样实际应用中的一种。

sentences.english: That sort of defeats are only stepping-stones.
sentences.chinese: 那种失败只不过是前进的塌脚石。

sentences.english: Dolcetto roughly translates from Italian as the "little sweet one."
sentences.chinese: 那只不过是意大利语“小甜甜”的意思。

sentences.english: I was nothing but a drop-out,but look at me now.
sentences.chinese: 我以前只不过是个辍学的人，但看看我现在。

sentences.english: It's a simple solid-silver piece at the end of that cord necklace.
sentences.chinese: 这只不过是一根普通的带有银质吊坠的吊绳项链。

sentences.english: I thought all this was simply a figment of one's imagination.
sentences.chinese: 我认为那些只不过是人们的凭空想像和虚构。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
in fact/in reality/as a matter of fact/in practice
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to appear to be/to seem as if
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
